2017/KER/463
SUNIL THOMAS, J.
Dated this the 5‚Äù day of January, 2017
ORDER

The dispute arises in relation to the Maruti WagonR
vehicle bearing registration No.KL-49G/2383, which was
subject matter of hire purchase agreement. It was seized
by the Kunnamkulam Police in Crime No.2593/2016 in a
complaint preferred by the petitioner herein against the
borrower. Pending the proceedings the registered owner
of the vehicle preferred Crl.M.C.7923/2016 along with his
mother seeking a stay of the entire proceedings. Stay for
a period of two months was granted by Annexure-2 order.
Subsequently by Annexure-3 order in
Cri.M.C.No.8919/2016 it was clarified that the interim
stay granted by the court will not stand in the way of the
court below taking up Crl.M.P.7435/2016 in Crime
No.2593/2016 of Kunnamkulam Police Station, which was
an application filed by the RC owner seeking interim
custody of the vehicle.

2. The grievance of the petitioner herein who is

2017/KER/463
Crl.M.C.No.93 of 2017 2
the financier is that, his application for interim custody is
not being taken for hearing on a premise that neither
Annexure-2 nor Annexure-3 authorised the court below to
take up his Crl.M.P.No.7525/2016. In the light of above,
it is clarified that the court below shall take up
Crl.MP.No.7525/2016 also along with
Crl.M.P.No.7435/2016 filed by the RC owner and dispose
of together.
Crl.M.C. is disposed of accordingly.
Sd/-
SUNIL THOMAS, JUDGE

RAV ITRUE COPY/I

PATO JUDGE
